reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed for one night as we were attending a friends wedding. We have stayed in several travel lodges in the UK, and never been dissapointed, sadly it was not the case here. Ridiculously small room, even smaller bathroom, one pillow, like paper, one towel, discoloured, holes in the bedroom wall. What an absolute dump. Will think twice now before I book a travel lodge.
reviews.title: never again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a travelodge and a fairly modern one that we thought was clean and fresh. The receptionist was friendly and helpful. The other good thing about it is that just over the road is a village hotel with a Starbucks, Bar and restaurant so there are alot of luxeries just a 2 minute wallk away. It was next to a road and a little noisy but this didn't affect our sleep.
reviews.title: good travelodge

reviews.text: We arrived after the scheduled booking in time and had to wait as there was no one at reception. Our room and bathroom were dirty and we required two extra pillows which had to be taken from another room. The problems were sorted out.
reviews.title: Poor experience and poor value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food and drink had been spilled over the settee / bed, what a mess. The only food available was from a vending machine and the only breakfast they could offer was 'breakfast in a bag'
reviews.title: One to avoid

reviews.text: We were still charged over £50 very, very poor value, not keeping up with the competition, they offer far more.
reviews.title: 2nd time staying here, just as good as first time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights during November. Got a great rate through Travelodge website, which was less than a quarter of the price we would have paid for the hotel directly opposite. (Met some people from there who were complaining about the size of their rooms whereas our room was huge).
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin

reviews.text: We booked a family room, having read reports that there is only one small chair in the ordinary rooms. This does make a difference as you can spread out a bit with somewhere more comfy to sit.
reviews.title: Great Location for an overnight stop.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in - the staff member on duty was excellent, friendly, fast and efficient - as were all staff members we had occasion to deal with.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT STAY – FANTASTIC VALUE.

reviews.text: The room, on the first floor faced the road, but we were not too disturbed by traffic noise - perhaps we were lucky, although the road outside is very very busy during rush hour so this may disturb some people and we were oblivious to any noise of traffic during the night - very peaceful even although the hotel was almost full.
reviews.title: Basic, functional, clean. Very helpful staff.

reviews.text: Everything in the room we could need, including extra towels, plenty of tea and coffee which was replenished next day.
reviews.title: Superb value for money, a clean and comfortable hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never stayed in one before. This is a new Travelodge in a quiet spot, with a major hotel opposite, so you have a quality bar, restaurant and facilities over the road. I got the room in the sale for £10 and £15 per night. It would be rude not to take this offer up!
reviews.title: Clean, excellent value at £25 for 2 nights!!!!

reviews.text: Like most people I wasn't staying here for the experience, just as a stop over for another event. The accomodation was excellent, quiet and included a reasonably sized flatscreen tv. The only let down was no milk for drinks on day 2, and it seemed beyond the means of the staff to buy some in locally. (Otherwise I'd give it 5*)
reviews.title: Our Favourite Travelodge so far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really handy for Chester, Bus 2 mins walk, trains 15 mins walk away, but if you include walking to the station each end they both take about an hour.
reviews.title: Very disappointing.

reviews.text: Do not forget you are 5 mins from Port Sunlight village (protected status and beautiful) which inlcudes the Lady Lever art gallery which is FREE! Easy to lose an afternoon here with some wonderful pieces.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: We have now stayed at this travelodge 3 times since it opened. It is a relatively new travelodge and it shows in its appearence and the furnishings.
reviews.title: £29 Family of 4 Saturday night cracking value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great stop off on our Christmas journeys, staff friendly and helpful, room very clean and warm.
reviews.title: Great cheap hotel £29 good breakfast at McDonalds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast for £4.50 is pants so use the friendly Mcdee round corner
reviews.title: Warm, friendly, very clean. Highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for one night. We chose the lodge because of the location,we were catching the early ferry from Birkenhead to Dublin. The ferry
reviews.title: very clean and new
